Job-Title: Intern or thesis student – Machine Learning for Construction (m/f/x)
Description:
What's the role?

You will join our international team in Corporate Research & Technology to evaluate and develop innovative algorithms and methods for solving problems in Construction applications using Machine Learning. You will work closely with our experts to make our tools smarter. You will contribute to future digitalization and automation of the construction sector.

Start date is flexible to the student's availability, duration for at least 6 months.
What does the role involve?

As an intern in our department you will be part of a development team researching Machine Learning and Deep Learning methods for solving problems in Construction. You will work closely with our experts to find and test innovative solutions using different data sources. You will contribute by developing new models and modifying existing models for applications in construction.

Your key responsibilities will be to evaluate state-of-the-art models and improve them to fit the application needs. You will... test and apply them in the real application and support our team in evaluating the most promising solutions.
What you need is:
• Current Master student in Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, Physics or similar discipline.
• Experience in one or more of the following fields: Deep Learning, Python.
• Good understanding of Tensorflow and/or Pytorch (preferably both)
• Experience with machine vision is a plus.
• Working knowledge of Linux systems is a plus.
• Ability to write clean and abstract code
• Strong communication skills, with good English and interpersonal skills.
• A proactive approach and self-reliant personality.

Why should you apply?

We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you have no knowledge of construction, that’s fine with us. We’re more interested in your ability, commitment and drive to succeed.
What do we offer?

We’ll give you the tools you need to excel in your internship, including one-to-one coaching. You’ll enjoy a rare combination of autonomy and camaraderie, as you’ll manage your own project while being part of a friendly team.

You’ll not just be another pair of hands but a fully integrated team member with lots of self-responsibility. From there, we’ll trust you to do whatever it takes to deliver outstanding results. Go the extra mile and we’ll reward you with strategic development discussions and career opportunities.

We’ll support you even before you start with us through relocation and integration support. With the international interns community at Hilti you’ll never be bored. Further, the snow-draped mountains, crystal-clear lakes and marvelous landscapes in the Happy Valley invite for lots of outdoor activities

What's the role?

You lead our multi-disciplinary Computer Vision & AI team in Corporate Research & Technology. You shape the mid-to long-term innovation roadmap, and drive projects definition and execution. Thanks to your leadership and coaching skills, you recruit and develop exceptional talent for the organization.
What does the role involve?

The Computer Vision & AI team is responsible to develop proof-of-concepts for new products and services for the organization. The team covers all areas of expertise needed to automate and digitize construction industry: Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Sensor Fusion algorithms, and IoT Technologies.
Together with your team, you identify innovation opportunities and you craft and implement a technology roadmap. You are confident managing a team while setting budgets, timelines, and operational targets for running R&D projects.
Your interpersonal skills allow you to successfully collaborate and align with the different Business Units in the... organization. You develop and nurture a strong external network with Academia and Industry to support R&D collaborations. You coach your team members to support their development and individual growth within the organization.
What you need is:
• MSc Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics or similar. PhD preferred
• 5+ years of relevant experience in Industry/Academia, with demonstrated growth in product development and/or engineering research. Prior direct line management experience preferred
• Technical expertise in several of: Computer Vision, Machine Learning, SLAM algorithms, Sensor Fusion, IoT Technologies
• Excellent project management skills and proven expertise with modern project management frameworks and tools (Agile, Jira, etc.)
• Good business acumen and strategic mindset
• Strong interpersonal and communication skills in spoken and written English. Comfortable with initiating and nurturing new connections in a matrix organization
• Collaborative mindset, capable to coach, motivate and lead by example

Why should you apply?

About you: you are someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, where a job title is not considered a final destination but the starting point.
What do we offer?

You will be working with a team of people striving for excellence, with an open, inclusive and supportive culture. Bring your own perspective and achieve results together with others. Come to a place where you will own your development and career journey: global or local, cross-functional or as a specialist. If you’re willing to go the extra mile, there is no limit to what you can achieve.
Relish the views from our modern and state-of-the art offices. Enjoy a variety of healthy foods from the campus restaurants, keep in shape at the in-house gym, or commute with our e-bikes free of charge. You will be amazed what the alpine life has to offer.
For the full range of benefits, take a look at https://careers.hilti.li/en-li/about-us/your-benefits-hilti
